content.raw:
Yes, I can use that one, instead of having update() there between mutex lines we can have vector of messages and call update in other places, in this case it may happen that a message never has been processed by the update(). InitMsg was initially implemented to store init message information for each update and it will be cleared in the update procedure. So we should have map of initMsg with socket_ID in order to store the initMsg to be used if there are any disconnections.
Finally, I can test the implementation of new update() only after I could compile the code with the latest Gazebo, could you compile your branch with the latest Gazebo?
content.html: Yes, I can use that one, instead of having update() there between mutex lines we can have vector of messages and call update in other places, in this case it may happen that a message never has been processed by the update(). InitMsg was initially implemented to store init message information for each update and it will be cleared in the update procedure. So we should have map of initMsg with socket_ID in order to store the initMsg to be used if there are any disconnections. Finally, I can test the implementation of new update() only after I could compile the code with the latest Gazebo, could you compile your branch with the latest Gazebo?
